codeart.studio.badge.youtube: Check out CodeArt Studio on YouTube
codeart.studio.command.continueReviewInI: Discard and Copy to Inline Chat

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.signIn.message:
Sign in to enable features powered by CodeArt Studio.

[Sign in](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetupForceSignIn)

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.individual.e:
Your Copilot subscription has expired.

[Review Copilot Settings](https://github.com/settings/copilot?editor=vscode)
codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.enterprise: Contact your GitHub organization administrator to enable Copilot.

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.offline.message:
You are currently offline. Please connect to the internet to use CodeArt Studio.

[Retry Connection](command:codeart.studio.refreshToken)

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.contactSuppo.message:
There seems to be a problem with your account. Please contact GitHub support.

[Contact Support](https://support.github.com/?editor=vscode)

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.chatDisabled.message:
CodeArt Studio Chat is currently disabled for your account by an organization administrator. Contact an organization administrator to enable chat.

[Learn More](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/managing-copilot/managing-github-copilot-in-your-organization/managing-github-copilot-features-in-your-organization/managing-policies-for-copilot-in-your-organization)

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.switchToRele.message:
The Pre-Release version of the CodeArt Studio Chat extension is not currently supported in the stable version of VS Code. Please switch to the release version for CodeArt Studio Chat or try VS Code Insiders.

[Switch to Release Version and Reload](command:runCommands?%7B%22commands%22%3A%5B%7B%22command%22%3A%22workbench.extensions.action.switchToRelease%22%2C%22args%22%3A%5B%22codeart-collective.codeart-studio-chat%22%5D%7D%2C%22workbench.action.reloadWindow%22%5D%7D)

[Switch to VS Code Insiders](https://aka.ms/vscode-insiders)

codeart.studio.viewsWelcome.debug.message: Debug using a [terminal command](command:codeart.studio.chat.startCopilotDebugCommand) or in an [interactive chat](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22query%22%3A%22%40vscode%20%2FstartDebugging%20%22%2C%22isPartialQuery%22%3Atrue%7D).

codeart.studio.config.enableCodeActions: Controls if Copilot commands are shown as Code Actions when available
Controls whether Copilot generates suggestions for renaming
codeart.studio.config.localeOverride: Specify a locale that Copilot should respond in, e.g. `en` or `fr`. By default, Copilot will respond using VS Code's configured display language locale.
codeart.studio.config.edits.enabled: Whether to enable the Copilot Edits feature.
codeart.studio.config.codesearch.enabled: Whether to enable agentic codesearch when using `#codebase`.
codeart.studio.nextEditSuggestions.enabl:
Whether to enable next edit suggestions (NES).

NES can propose a next edit based on your recent changes. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/vscode-nes) about next edit suggestions.
codeart.studio.nextEditSuggestions.fixes: Whether to offer fixes for diagnostics via next edit suggestions (NES).
codeart.studio.nextEditSuggestions.allow: Whether to allow whitespace-only changes be proposed by next edit suggestions (NES).
Whether the `copilot-debug` command is enabled in the terminal.
codeart.studio.config.terminalChatLocati: Controls where chat queries from the terminal should be opened.
codeart.studio.config.scopeSelection: Whether to prompt the user to select a specific symbol scope if the user uses `/explain` and the active editor has no selection.
codeart.studio.config.debugTerminalComma: Whether to quick fix hints in the debug terminal and the `copilot-debug` command.
A list of commands for which the "Debug Command" quick fix action should be shown in the debug terminal.
codeart.studio.config.edits.suggestRelat: Whether to suggest related files from git history for the Copilot Edits working set.
codeart.studio.chat.edits.suggestRelated: Whether to suggest source files from test files for the Copilot Edits working set.
codeart.studio.config.codeGeneration.ins:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Use instructions files instead. See https://aka.ms/vscode-ghcp-custom-instructions for more information.
codeart.studio.config.codeGeneration.use:
Controls whether code instructions from `.github/copilot-instructions.md` are added to Copilot requests.

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/github-copilot-custom-instructions) about customizing Copilot.
codeart.studio.config.codeGeneration.ins: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
codeart.studio.config.testGeneration.ins:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Use instructions files instead. See https://aka.ms/vscode-ghcp-custom-instructions for more information.
codeart.studio.config.experimental.testG: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
codeart.studio.config.reviewSelection.en: Enables code review on current selection.
codeart.studio.config.reviewSelection.in:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's effectiveness.
A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
codeart.studio.config.commitMessageGener:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use conventional commit message format." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Text instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
A path to a file with instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate commit messages.
codeart.studio.config.pullRequestDescrip:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Always include a list of key changes." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
Text instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
A path to a file with instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate pull request titles and descriptions.
codeart.studio.config.generateTests.code: Show 'Generate tests' code lens for symbols that are not covered by current test coverage information.
codeart.studio.config.notebook.followCel: Controls whether the currently executing cell is revealed into the viewport upon execution from Copilot.
codeart.studio.config.notebook.enhancedN: Controls whether to use an enhanced approach for generating next edit suggestions in notebook cells.
codeart.studio.chat.editor.temporalConte: When making inline chat request whether to include recently viewed and edited files with Copilot requests.
codeart.studio.config.imageUpload.enable: Enables the use of image upload URLs in chat requests instead of raw base64 strings.
codeart.studio.chat.edits.temporalContex: When making edits request whether to include recently viewed and edited files with Copilot requests.
codeart.studio.config.setupTests.enabled: Enables the `/setupTests` intent and prompting in `/tests` generation.
codeart.studio.config.byok.ollamaEndpoin: The endpoint to use for the Ollama when accessed via bring your own key. Defaults to localhost.
codeart.studio.config.virtualTools.thres:
This setting defines the tool count over which virtual tools should be used. Virtual tools group similar sets of tools together and they allow the model to activate them on-demand. Certain tool groups will optimistically be pre-activated. We are actively developing this feature and you experience degraded tool calling once the threshold is hit.

May be set to `0` to disable virtual tools.
codeart.studio.config.alternateGptPrompt: Enables an experimental alternate prompt for GPT models instead of the default prompt.
codeart.studio.config.gpt5AlternatePromp: Specifies an experimental alternate prompt to use for GPT-5 models.
codeart.studio.config.gpt5CodexAlternate: Specifies an experimental alternate prompt to use for the GPT-5-Codex model.
codeart.studio.config.grokCodeAlternateP: Specifies an experimental alternate prompt to use for Grok Code models.
codeart.studio.config.claudeSonnet45Alte: Specifies an experimental alternate prompt to use for Claude Sonnet 4.5.

codeart.studio.walkthrough.title: CodeArt Studio
codeart.studio.walkthrough.description: Your AI pair programmer to write code faster and smarter
codeart.studio.command.refreshClaudeCode: Refresh Claude Code CLI Agent Sessions
codeart.studio.walkthrough.signIn.title: Sign in with GitHub
codeart.studio.walkthrough.signIn.descri:
To get started with Copilot, sign in with your GitHub account.
Make sure you're using the correct GitHub account. You can also sign in later using the account menu.

[Sign In](command:codeart.studio.signIn)
Sign in to GitHub via this walkthrough or VS Code's account menu
Sign in to use Copilot for free

You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans) with your GitHub account.

[Use Copilot for Free](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetupForceSignIn)
Get started with Copilot for free

You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans) with your GitHub account.

[Use Copilot for Free](command:workbench.action.chat.triggerSetupForceSignIn)
codeart.studio.walkthrough.setup.noActio:
You can use Copilot to generate code across multiple files, fix errors, ask questions about your code and much more using natural language.
 We now offer [Copilot for free](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans) with your GitHub account.
As you type in the editor, Copilot suggests code to help you complete what you started.
The video shows different Copilot completions, where Copilot suggests code to help the user complete their code
codeart.studio.walkthrough.panelChat.des:
Ask Copilot programming questions or get help with your code using **@workspace**.
 Type **@** to see all available chat participants that you can chat with directly, each with their own expertise.
[Chat with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22mode%22%3A%22ask%22%7D)
codeart.studio.walkthrough.panelChat.med: The user invokes @workspace in the Chat panel in the secondary sidebar to understand the code base. Copilot retrieves the relevant information and provides a response with links to the files
codeart.studio.walkthrough.inlineChatNot: Use natural language in your files

Sometimes, it's easier to describe the code you want to write directly within a file.
Place your cursor or make a selection and use **``Ctrl+I``** to open **Inline Chat**.

Inline Chat view in the editor. The video shows the user invoking the inline chat widget and asking Copilot to make a change in the file using natural language. Copilot then makes the requested change
codeart.studio.walkthrough.inlineChatMac: Use natural language in your files

Sometimes, it's easier to describe the code you want to write directly within a file.
Place your cursor or make a selection and use **``Cmd+I``** to open **Inline Chat**.
The video shows the user invoking the inline chat widget and asking Copilot to make a change in the file using natural language. Copilot then makes the requested change
codeart.studio.walkthrough.edits.title: Make changes using natural language
codeart.studio.walkthrough.edits.descrip:
Use **Copilot Edits** to select files you want to work with and describe changes you want to make. Copilot applies them directly to your files.
[Edit with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open?%7B%22mode%22%3A%22edit%22%7D)
codeart.studio.walkthrough.edits.media.a: The video shows the user dragging and dropping files into the Copilot Edits input box located in the secondary sidebar. Copilot then updates the file according to the userâ€™s request
codeart.studio.walkthrough.sparkle.title: Look out for smart actions
codeart.studio.walkthrough.sparkle.descr:
Copilot enhances your coding experience with AI-powered smart actions throughout the VS Code interface.
Look for $(sparkle) icons, such as in the [Source Control view](command:workbench.view.scm), where Copilot generates commit messages and PR descriptions based on code changes.

[Discover Tips and Tricks](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/copilot-vscode-features)
codeart.studio.walkthrough.sparkle.media: The video shows the sparkle icon in the source control input box being clicked, triggering CodeArt Studio to generate a commit message automatically
codeart.studio.chat.completionContext.ty: The execution mode of the TypeScript Copilot context provider.
codeart.studio.chat.languageContext.type: Enables the TypeScript language context provider for inline completions
Controls which kind of items are included in the TypeScript language context provider.
Controls whether to include documentation comments in the generated code snippets.
The cache population timeout for the TypeScript language context provider in milliseconds. The default is 500 milliseconds.
Enables the TypeScript language context provider for /fix commands
codeart.studio.chat.languageContext.inli: Enables the TypeScript language context provider for inline chats (both generate and edit)
codeart.studio.config.enableUserPreferen: Enable remembering user preferences in agent mode.

codeart.studio.config.newWorkspace.useCo: Whether to use the [Context7](command:codeart.studio.mcp.viewContext7) tools to scaffold project for new workspace creation.
codeart.studio.config.editsNewNotebook.e: Whether to enable the new notebook tool in Copilot Edits.
codeart.studio.config.notebook.inlineEdi: Enable agent-like behavior from the notebook inline chat widget.
codeart.studio.config.summarizeAgentConv: Whether to auto-summarize agent conversation history once the context window is filled.

codeart.studio.config.agent.currentEdito: When enabled, Copilot will include the name of the current active editor in the context for agent mode.
codeart.studio.config.customInstructions: When enabled, custom instructions and mode instructions will be appended to the system message instead of a user message.
copilot.toolSet.search.description: Search and read files in your workspace
copilot.toolSet.new.description: Scaffold a new workspace with VS Code-specific configurations to compile, debug and run new projects.
codeart.studio.config.useResponsesApi:
Use the Responses API instead of the Chat Completions API when supported. Enables reasoning and reasoning summaries.

**Note**: This is an experimental feature that is not yet activated for all users.
codeart.studio.config.responsesApiReason: Sets the reasoning effort used for the Responses API. Requires `#codeart.studio.chat.useResponsesApi#`.
Sets the reasoning summary style used for the Responses API. Requires `#codeart.studio.chat.useResponsesApi#`.
codeart.studio.config.completionsFetcher: Sets the fetcher used for the inline completions.
codeart.studio.config.nesFetcher: Sets the fetcher used for the next edit suggestions.
copilot.tools.runSubagent.name: Run Subagent
copilot.tools.runSubagent.description: Runs a task within an isolated subagent context. Enables efficient organization of tasks and context window management.
myai.config.endpoint: Endpoint URL for the MyAI service.
myai.config.defaultModel: Default model identifier to request from MyAI.
